intro: Limonium peruvianum, commonly known as the Peruvian sea lavender, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of South America. It belongs to the Plumbagaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils along the shorelines, thriving in saline environments. Its flowering period occurs during the summer months, and it is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance. Limonium peruvianum is also valued for its ability to stabilize coastal dunes and prevent erosion.
